title: Canoeing at the 2000 Summer Olympics – Men's K-4 1000 metres
text:
The men's K-4 1000 metres event was a fours <a href="kayak">kayak</a>ing event conducted as part of the <a href="Canoeing%20at%20the%202000%20Summer%20Olympics">Canoeing at the 2000 Summer Olympics</a> program.
Results.
Heats.
13 crews entered in two heats. The top three finishers in each heat advanced to the final while the remaining teams competed in the semifinal.
Overall Results Heats
Yugoslavia is shown as Serbia and Montenegro (SCG) in the sports-reference.com website.
Semifinals.
The top three finishers in the semifinal advanced to the final.
Final.
Germany won the K-4 1000 m <a href="ICF%20Canoe%20Sprint%20World%20Championships">world championships</a> in <a href="1997%20ICF%20Canoe%20Sprint%20World%20Championships">1997</a> and <a href="1998%20ICF%20Canoe%20Sprint%20World%20Championships">1998</a> while Hungary won in <a href="1999%20ICF%20Canoe%20Sprint%20World%20Championships">1999</a>. Germany won the European championships in July 2000, but the Hungarians won the Olympic final by about 2.5 meter (8 feet).
